block.p: Alice Miriam Stagg and Thor Tembeya Mann, management consultants, were married yesterday by Rabbi Dennis Shulman at the Grounds for Sculpture, a museum and park in Hamilton, N.J.
The bride, 36, and bridegroom, 31, graduated from Reed College.
Alice Miriam Stagg and Thor Tembeya Mann, management consultants, were married yesterday by Rabbi Dennis Shulman at the Grounds for Sculpture, a museum and park in Hamilton, N.J.
Alice Miriam Stagg and Thor Tembeya Mann, management consultants, were married yesterday by Rabbi Dennis Shulman at the Grounds for Sculpture, a museum and park in Hamilton, N.J.
The bride, 36, and bridegroom, 31, graduated from Reed College.

Mrs. Mann does freelance work in New York helping companies organize their internal structure. She is to begin studying in September for a doctorate in organizational psychology at Columbia, where she also received a master's degree. She also received a certificate in organizational dynamics from the William Alanson White Institute, a psychoanalytic training institute in New York.
She is a daughter of Barbara L. Stagg of Cotati, Calif., and David C. Stagg III of Santa Rosa, Calif.
Mr. Mann works in New York as an executive coach for RHR International, an Illinois consulting firm. He received master's and doctorate degrees in organizational psychology at Rutgers.
He is the son of Anna L. Mann of Frillesas, Sweden, and Roger E. Mann of Naples, Fla.
